taskDescription:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mrow>
    <mo>(</mo>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mtext>~</mtext>
      <mrow>
        <mo>(</mo>
        <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
          <mi>p</mi>
          <mo stretchy="false">→<!-- → --></mo>
          <mi>q</mi>
        </mrow>
        <mo>)</mo>
      </mrow>
    </mrow>
    <mo>)</mo>
  </mrow>
  <mo>≡<!-- ≡ --></mo>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">→<!-- → --></mo>
  <mi>q</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\text{~}\left( {\text{~}\left( {p \to q} \right)} \right) \equiv p \to q</annotation></semantics></math>, which means the conditional statement is logically equivalent to <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mrow>
    <mo>(</mo>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mi>p</mi>
      <mo>∧<!-- ∧ --></mo>
      <mtext>~</mtext>
      <mi>q</mi>
    </mrow>
    <mo>)</mo>
  </mrow>
  <mo>.</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\text{~}\left( {p \wedge \text{~}q} \right).</annotation></semantics></math> Apply _______________________ to the statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mrow>
    <mo>(</mo>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mi>p</mi>
      <mo>∧<!-- ∧ --></mo>
      <mtext>~</mtext>
      <mi>q</mi>
    </mrow>
    <mo>)</mo>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\text{~}\left( {p \wedge \text{~}q} \right)</annotation></semantics></math> to show that the conditional statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">→<!-- → --></mo>
  <mi>q</mi>
  <mo>≡<!-- ≡ --></mo>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo>∨<!-- ∨ --></mo>
  <mi>q</mi>
  <mo>.</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">p \to q \equiv \text{~}p \vee q.</annotation></semantics></math>
